description: From Arabic دِينَار‎ (dīnār) and Serbo-Croatian динар (also from Arabic), derived from the Latin dēnārius. Doublet of denar and denarius.

entries.meaning: The official currency of several countries, including Algeria, Bahrain, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Libya, Serbia, Tunisia and (as denar) North Macedonia.
(historical) An ancient Arab gold coin of 65 grains in weight.
